channel.title: Hm.. Need a little help with a code, i know im missing something

item.title: Hm.. Need a little help with a code, i know im missing something
item.dc:creator: @Server_Creator_Brian Server Creator Brian
item.description:
@Server_Creator_Brian wrote:

[code] if(pnp.npcType == 4906)
{
if(Engine.playerItems.HasItemAmount(p, 1513, 1) == true)
{
Engine.playerItems.addItem(p, 995, 1237);
Engine.playerItems.deleteItem(p,1513, Engine.playerItems.getItemSlot(p, 1513), 1);
p.frames.showChatboxInterface(p, 241);
p.frames.animateInterfaceId(p, 9850, 241, 2);
p.frames.setNPCId(p, 4906, 241, 2);
p.frames.setString(p, “Woodcutting Tutor”, 241, 3);
p.frames.setString(p, “Thank you for the Magic logs!”, 241, 4);
}

p.frames.setString(p, “Thank you for the logs!”, 241, 4);
}
else if(p.skillLvl[8] > 98)
{ GetSkillCape(p, 15, 4906, “Woodcutting Tutor”, “Woodcutting”); }

else { OnlyLevel(p, 16, 4906, “Woodcutting Tutor”, 8, “Woodcutting”); }

}
[/code]

I am using a bulby based source, and yes it is a 508.

Ok, so, i put that code in to my NPCOption1.java file, and when i go in game if i have 100 or 1 of any of the above codes (noted or un noted) it says Thank you for the (type) logs. But if i have, lets say, 101 or 123 or 2 or 8, it says, “Ah, it seems you are a master of woodcutting, take this cape as a reward” I know that its SUPPOSED to say that if you have 99 woodcutting, but above it says if you have 100 or 1 of the logs noted or un noted, it should say “Thank you, blah blah blah.”. I know that i need to put something in there to make it so if its 1 or more of that log. But i still want the same price for them. If you can help that would be great, because i really dont wanna add it so that i have to go back and do 2 - 199… thanks.

Read full topic
